intro: Anelsonia eurycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruit anelsonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many members of the Malvaceae family. Anelsonia eurycarpa is often found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
